result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: the photocatalytic reduction reactions, CO 2 was mainly reduced to methane (CH 4 ).The CH 4 generation rate of the pristine CdS NSs is measured about 0.021 mmol h A1 g A1 .Combination of CdS NSs with TiO 2 to form CdSTiO 2 heterostructure increases the CH 4 generation rate by 40, which is ascribed to spatial separation of electrons and holes between two components.Furthermore, coupling the CdS NSs with rGO makes apparent increase of CH 4 evolution by 3 times compared to the pristine CdS NSs.It demonstrates

Mimicking natural photosynthesis in green plants, an all-solid-state Z-scheme was constructed for photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 in the presence of water vapor, consisting of CdS nanospheres (CdS NSs) and TiO 2 nanoparticles as photocatalysts, and reduced graphene oxide (rGO) as a solid electron mediator.In this Z-scheme system, the photogenerated electrons from the conduction band of TiO 2 transfer to rGO, and then recombine with the existing holes of CdS NSs, allowing the photo-generated electrons to

the photocatalytic activity.A CO 2 reduction cycle on the same CdS NSsrGOTiO 2 catalyst shows 10 decrease of CH 4 generation velocity (Fig. S4 ).The rate decrease may be due to the deactivation of the surface catalytic sites of the photocatalyst, possibly resulting from covering of the reduced carbon species.The generation rate ratio of O 2 to CH 4 over CdS NSsrGOTiO 2 is 1.7 : 1, close to the theoretical mole ratio of 2 : 1 (CO 2 2H 2 O CH 4 2O 2 ).No nitrogen was detected in the reaction system (Fig. S5

photo-generated electrons to enrich on the CdS semiconductor and holes on the TiO 2 .The photocatalytic efficiency of the Z-scheme system exhibits remarkable enhancement relative to pure CdS, CdSTiO 2 , and CdSrGO.

NSs.This mechanism accumulates holes in TiO 2 for oxidation of H 2 O and electrons in CdS for photoreduction of CO 2 , respectively.The depressed hole density on CdS may also enhance the stability of CdS against photocorrosion. 14

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

evidence.pdf_reference: UV-visible (UV-vis) absorption spectrum was measured on a UV-vis spectrophotometer (UV-2550, Shimadzu) at room temperature.The transient time-resolved photoluminescence decay measurements were recorded on a uorescence spectrometer (FLS920, Edinburgh Instruments). In the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 , a 300 W xenon arc lamp was used as the light source at a distance of about 10 cm with cooling water and no other lters placed between the lamp and samples and the input optical power is approximately 50

power is approximately 50 W.The gas-tight reaction system had a volume of about 230 ml and was vacuum-treated several times (Fig. S1 ).Then, high purity of CO 2 gas was injected into the reaction system for reaching ambient pressure.0.4 ml of deionized water was injected into the reaction system.The gases were stored in the dark for several hours to reach the equilibrium of the CO 2 and H 2 O and ensure that the adsorption of gas molecules was complete.During irradiation, about 1 ml of gas was continually

in the reaction system (Fig. S5 ), which eliminates the possibility of origination of oxygen from the ambient atmosphere.A CO 2 reduction experiment performed in the dark or in the absence of the photocatalysts showed no appearance of CH 4 production, proving that the CO 2 reduction reaction is driven by light with the photocatalysts.No methane can be detected when high purity of N 2 gas instead of CO 2 was injected into the reaction system, suggesting that CO 2 should be the source of methane.
